Logic & Deduction.name: The Enigma Weaver's Challenge
Logic & Deduction.description: Test your powers of deduction and logical reasoning in this intricate quiz. Unravel perplexing scenarios and decipher hidden clues to prove your intellect. Prepare to be challenged as you navigate a labyrinth of puzzles designed to test your mind.

questions.text: A farmer has chickens and cows. He counts 24 heads and 72 legs. How many cows does he have?
questions.hint: Consider the number of legs each animal has.

questions.text: Three friends  Alice, Bob, and Carol  each have a different favorite color: red, blue, or green. Alice doesn's like red. Bob says, 'My favorite color isn't blue.' Carol's favorite color is not green. What is Carol's favorite color?
questions.hint: Use a process of elimination to determine each person's preference.

questions.text: If all Bloops are Floops, and some Floops are Gloops, then which of the following MUST be true?
questions.hint: Think about the relationship between the categories.

questions.text: A digital clock shows the time as 1:05. What is the next time when all the digits are the same?
questions.hint: Consider the constraints of a digital clock.

questions.text: You have two ropes. Each rope takes exactly one hour to burn completely, but they don't burn at a constant rate. How can you measure exactly 45 minutes using only these two ropes?
questions.hint: Think about starting ropes at different times.
questions.option1: Burn one rope completely and then burn the other for 45 minutes.
questions.option2: Burn one rope halfway and then burn the other for 22.5 minutes.
questions.option3: Light one rope at both ends and the other rope at one end.
questions.option4: Burn both ropes at one end for 22.5 minutes.

questions.text: A king arranges his daughters in a line based on their ages. The oldest daughter is not next to the youngest. The second oldest is in the middle. The third oldest is next to the youngest. If there are four daughters, what is the order from oldest to youngest?
questions.hint: Consider the constraints given in the problem.

questions.text: A sequence of numbers is generated by the rule: x(n+1) = 2*x(n) - x(n-1). If x(1) = 2 and x(2) = 2, what is x(3)?
questions.hint: Apply the given rule to find the next term in the sequence.

questions.text: A train leaves New York at 6:00 AM traveling at 60 mph. Another train leaves Chicago at 7:00 AM traveling at 80 mph. If the distance between New York and Chicago is 780 miles, at what time will the two trains meet?
questions.hint: Consider the head start of the first train.
